page.title: 02Mining Influences
page.content: Binley is an old mining area. Many of the houses on the new estate of Ernesford Grange are built on the old mine site. Binley is still often referred to as Binley Village and Abbey Cottages on the main road are well known as mining cottages. Even new enterprises still retain old links. When a new post-office opened recently along Quorn Way it was named Binley Colliery Village Post Office even though the mine had long been closed. When a new pub opened about six years ago it looked to local history not only for its name but for its decor and was called "The Iron Man" and features along its walls photographs of miners digging for coal. Roads on the new council estate are named after miners and many of these names are to be found on the gravestones in St. Bartholomews Church
